    About this blog

    After years of expounding my ideas in places like pubs and football grounds, I’ve somewhat belatedly decided that a blog would be a better medium, not least because it’s almost impossible to find a proxy for Javascript markdown in a beer garden.

    I’m in my 30s, I come from Yorkshire, I live in London, and I enjoy hacking (mostly in Meteor) and running (when I’m not injured). There’s more about me on here, or you could follow me on Twitter if you think you’re capable of tolerating this sort of drivel in bite-sized pieces.
